N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 9 ยง 8800.2 - Statement of purpose and applicability

State Regulations

The purpose of this Part is to establish the procedures
governing the issuance of advisory opinions by the office pursuant to State

Administrative Procedure Act, section 204(2)(b). Where an agency declines to
issue a declaratory ruling or rules that its action need not be taken pursuant
to a rule, in response to a petition pursuant to State Administrative Procedure

Act, section 204(1)(ii), such declination or ruling, upon petition of the
original petitioner, may be reviewed by the office. The office shall review the
petition for an advisory opinion, the agency's response to the petition for a
declaratory ruling, the agency's response to the petition for an advisory
opinion, if any, the agency action in question and any other pertinent
information or material and issue an advisory opinion as to whether the action
in question should be taken pursuant to a rule. Notes
